thread.title: Restaurant plans to give percent of opening-day proceeds to preemies
thread.title_full: Restaurant plans to give percent of opening-day proceeds to preemies

author: Kelly Schafler, kelly.schafler@chron.com
title: Restaurant plans to give percent of opening-day proceeds to preemies
text:
Restaurant plans to give percent of opening-day proceeds to preemies By Kelly Schafler, kelly.schafler@chron.com Published 4:46 pm, Tuesday, March 21,   2 Close Image 1 of 2 Salata, a salad bar restaurant, has opened a new venue off of College Park Drive near St. Luke's Way. The grand opening is on Thursday, March 24 at 11 a.m. A percentage of proceeds from the grand opening will benefit March for Dimes. less Salata, a salad bar restaurant, has opened a new venue off of College Park Drive near St. Luke's Way. The grand opening is on Thursday, March 24 at 11 a.m. A percentage of proceeds from the grand opening will ... more Photo:   2 Salata, a salad bar restaurant, has opened a new venue off of College Park Drive near St. Luke's Way. The grand opening is on Thursday, March 24 at 11 a.m. A percentage of proceeds from the grand opening will benefit March for Dimes. less Salata, a salad bar restaurant, has opened a new venue off of College Park Drive near St. Luke's Way. The grand opening is on Thursday, March 24 at 11 a.m. A percentage of proceeds from the grand opening will ... more Photo:   Restaurant plans to give percent of opening-day proceeds to preemies 1 / 2 Back to Gallery 
It can be a bonus to participate in something not only good for others but good for oneself. The premiere of Salata's second location on Thursday in The Woodlands allows patrons to do just that. 
The salad franchise serves fresh ingredients that are hand-made daily, with gluten-free dressings, soups and sauces. Patrons order through an assembly-line process where they can choose from wraps, salads, soups, bread, pasta, pita chips and desserts. 
While the health-conscious restaurant has been in the soft-opening phase for roughly a week, the grand opening on Thursday will donate 10 percent of the daily proceeds to benefit March of Dimes , an international campaign raising funds for research and treatment of premature babies. 
Woodlands Salata franchisee Amy Qualley and her husband bought the Market Street Salata location in 2011. The Qualley's plan to open a third location within a year, hopefully off Woodlands Parkway and Kuykendahl Road. 
Shortly after purchasing the Market Street Salata, the Qualley's began partnering with The Woodlands Preemies, a fundraising group for March of Dimes, by donating time and food to the group's annual event, Bingo for Babies. 
Qualley said she has a personal connection with March of Dimes, because she and her husband lost their baby when Qualley was roughly eight-and-a-half months pregnant. While this was years ago, when Ashley Williams of The Woodlands Preemies asked for help, the Qualley's knew they wanted to partner with the community in whatever way they could. 
Williams, whose twins were born premature at 25-weeks, is a team captain for The Woodlands Preemies. The group is made of mothers and families in Montgomery County who have been affected by prematurity in some way; they've raised over $34,000 for March of Dimes in the two years they have participated. 
According to marchofdimes.org, of the 15 million babies that are born prematurely yearly around the world, 1 million of those will not survive. The average medical cost of a premature baby is also considerably more expensive than that of a healthy baby, roughly $54,000 compared to $4,300. 
With The Woodlands Preemies' partnership with Salata, Williams said she hopes the grand opening day will raise thousands of dollars for March of Dimes. 
"Babies don't have a voice when they're born this premature and sick, so they need us in the community to fight for them," Williams said. "Every donation is so important, because it goes toward the research and therapies these children need to have a healthy life." 
The newest Salata opens Thursday, March 23 at 3091 College Park Drive, Suite 290 in The Woodlands. Doors open at 11 a.m. and the first 50 dine-in customers will eat for free. For those who can't be the first 50, t-shirts, tumblers and coupons will be dispersed while supplies last. 
Normal hours of operation will be 11a.m. to 9 p.m. Monday thru Saturday and 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Sunday. For more information, visit salata.com or call 936-703-6194.
